item.title: Intro to Python
item.description: A glimpse into some python tools I have learned in my Computational Biology course. R and Python Interaction Reticulate package allows R and Python to interact with each other. # R code library(reticulate) la<-"indian" # Python code import re la="blanket" # R code: access R-defined objects with r cat(c(la,py$la)) ## indian blanket # Python code: access Python-defined objects with py$ print(r.la,la) ## indian blanket Regular Expressions (regex) Regular Expressions search for defined patterns in a block of text.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
